qas.question: How did Lavoisier produce hydrogen for his experiments?

answers.text: reacting a flux of steam with metallic iron through an incandescent iron tube heated in a fire

context: Lavoisier produced hydrogen for his experiments on mass conservation by <a0_0>reacting a flux of steam with metallic iron through an incandescent iron tube heated in a fire<a0_0/>.
